metadata.title: CVE-2018-10873 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A vulnerability was discovered in SPICE before version 0.14.1 where the generated code used for demarshalling messages lacked sufficient bounds checks. A malicious client or server, after authentication, could send specially crafted messages to its peer which would result in a crash or, potentially, other impacts.

notes.note: leosilva> for xenial this bug is affected in spice-protocol only.

criterions.comment: spice package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.14.0-1ubuntu4').
spice-gtk package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.35-2').
